description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73a) to vary condition 2 (Approved Drawings) and condition 3 (External Materials) of planning permission ref: 184352FUL dated 06/03/2019 for: Construction of a part single, part two storey dwelling house with associated cycle parking and landscaping. Variation seeks enlargement of approved window at first floor on the North elevation; minor material changes to the external elevations involving replacement of clay tiles at first floor with brick, to match the brick at ground floor, and replacement of clay tiles on the roof with slate tiles.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of Planning Permission Ref. 184352FUL granted on 06/03/2019.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): P01 (Rev. C), P02 (Rev. D), P11 (Rev. D), P13 (Rev. F), P12 (Rev.F) (received on 11/03/2021), P14 (Rev. C), P15 (Rev. C), P.16 (Rev. 01), P.17 (Rev. 01), Planning Statement prepared by Nicholas Taylor & Associates (dated September 2018), Design and Access Statement (dated August 2018), Ultra-A technical date sheet by MultiPro System dated July.28.2017 (received on 17/02/2021), Accoya timber sample photo (received on 17/02/2021), Standing seam single ply (received on 12/02/2021), Fire Retardant for Accoya by MultiPro System (received on 10/02/2021), Accoya Wood Data Sheet by accoya (received on 10/02/2021), Accoya Brochure by accoya (received on 10/02/2021), Cover Letter (received on 05/02/2021), Construction Method Statement (Rev. 01) prepared by Alma-Nac (dated 18/12/2019), Drawing No. P11 (Rev. 01) - Swept Path Analysis, Drawing No. P18 (Rev. 01) - Construction Site Plan, BS5837 Arboricultural Report prepared by Crown Consultants (dated 7th September 2018), CCL10104/TCP (Rev. 2) - Tree Constraints Plan, CCL10104/IAP (Rev. 1) - Impact Assessment Plan, CCL10104/TPP (Rev. 1) - Tree Protection Plan, CCL10104/PLP (Rev. 1) - Proposed Tree Planting Plan, Tree Planting Schedule
unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| All tree protection methods as detailed in Arboricultural Report (Prepared by Crown Consultants dated 7th September 2018), Tree Schedule (unnumbered), and Tree Plans numbered CCL10104/TCP (Rev. 2), CCL10104/IAP (Rev. 1), CCL10104/TPP (Rev. 1), CCL10104/PLP (Rev. 1) shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.

REASON: To secure the protection, throughout the time that the development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within or adjacent to the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with policy 5.10 of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy G5 of the London Plan (2021).
| The construction method of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the Construction Method Statement under ref: 195410CND dated 11.02.2020.

REASON: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies T3, T4, T5, T6, T6.1, SI1 and D14  of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in the curtilage of the proposed building and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

REASON: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD  (2013) and policies D4, D5, T5 and S18 of the London Plan (2021).

| Cycle storage for a minimum of two (2) bicycles shall be provided onsite in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
REASON: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and the London Plan (2021).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To ensure satisfactory amenity is achieved for future residents of the site in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and polices D3, D4 and D14 of the London Plan (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement or other alteration of the dwellinghouse other than that expressly authorised by this permission shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local planning authority.

REASON: The local planning authority considers that further development could cause detriment to the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area and for this reason would wish to control any future development to comply with section 7 pf the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021).

| Any lighting to be provided along the access way shall be down facing and no higher than 1.2m, to minimise any potential light spill to adjoining properties. The bollard lights shall be provided along the full length of the access way.
REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the area, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013).
| The tree monitoring program shall be carried out in accordance with the approved tree documents under ref: 200070CND dated 10.02.2020.

REASON: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G5 and G7 of the London Plan (2021), policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.
